created_time: December 30, 2022, 10:13:52 PMLast edit: March 28, 2024, 01:41:17 AM by bitmover
content: This an animated chart created with data from Rikafip post [CHARTS] Brief monthly overview of the local boards activity.I scraped the data from each chart and added here in this new animated chart, as suggested by dkbit98 Â and Rikafip.We can see the evolution of each local board activity since 2020.https://public.flourish.studio/visualisation/12312077/I hope you guys enjoy. I am open for suggestions.I was thinking about adding flags on each board, but I felt this very complicated as some languages/board might be shared along many different countries.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: Well done bitmover!It's incredible to see the numbers in this way, we can see interesting things like Turkish board, 2nd place right now but with tons of posts, probably because the situation in their country, inflation and now people are more interested in cryptos.Italian board, November 2021, 1st place, with a huge spike in posts. (Do you know the reason?)And the most interesting board, Russian from Jun 2021 to July 2021. Why did this board have only a few posts in this period, disappearing from the top 18?

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: very good work bitmover.Through the animated chart, I see very little activity in some local boards. I don't know why. Is it because Crypto is not widespread in these countries, or is it because members from these countries write in English most of the time?I also think that signature campaigns may play a role in the low activity of some local boards, because some signature campaigns do not count posts in local boards. This is why many members do not write in their local language.

comments.body: Great visualization about post counts, I've shared it in our German section. comments.author: MAAManda
comments.created_time: January 02, 2023, 04:49:39 AMLast edit: January 02, 2023, 05:15:59 AM by MAAManda
comments.body: Good work @bitmover, with this animated chart, of course, it will be very easy for us to see how the evolution of posts on each local board. But I have a little question about this.Do we get important points from the chart you made? I see that the animated chart that you made was taken from data for 2020 to November 2022, besides that the data also doesn't accumulate from every month data.We (at Indonesia's local board) have our own topic for monthly charts which are regularly updated, besides that, we also evaluate and discuss there. Therefore, I think that's better to have this animated chart made for quarterly, or yearly. So, someone from 1 local board can bring it to their local board and get points from the quarterly or yearly data (for local board evaluation purposes to make it more good). And it would be better if we have quarterly or yearly data accumulated from each month.Example:January = 200 posts | February = 230 posts | March = 100 postsSo, the result for the Q1 data is 530 postsNote: I know that what I'm saying can be done even without this animated chart, but it would be better with animated charts. This is just a little suggestion, accepted or not it's @OP's right.
